metadata.title: CVE-2022-20421 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In binder_inc_ref_for_node of binder.c, there is a possible way to corruptmemory due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interactionis not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: AndroidkernelAndroid ID: A-239630375References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20421` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16

linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-201-generic - 4.15.0-201.212~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-201-generic - 4.15.0-201.212~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-201-lowlatency - 4.15.0-201.212~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-201.212~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1147.159~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1159.174~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.158~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1112.123~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
